intro_text: You see the first snowflakes of leaf-bare falling down. You can't help but notice r_c looking up at the sky with wonder. Maybe you should play in the snow with them?
decline_text: You decide against it. You don't want to freeze to death, after all.

success_outcomes.text: They agree to it! You walk through the forest, tails entwined, when suddenly you feel a shower of ice hit your face! You look to r_c bewilderedly, realizing that they flicked snow at you! You have a snow battle that ends with the both of you dissolving into giggles.

fail_outcomes.text: You walk up to r_c and invite them to play, but they think you're joking. You laugh along with them, but you can't help but feel a sore disappointment.

intro_text: You and r_c go on a patrol alone, and it has gone wonderfully thus far. However, you feel the need to ask if the other considers this a date.
decline_text: Your nerves get to you, and you find yourself unable to speak.

success_outcomes.text: r_c shies away from your gaze, but nods slowly and smiles.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c almost seems a little offended that you'd asked and declines hastily, making things awkward.

intro_text: You hear around the den about a shooting star event happening that evening. You consider asking r_c about whether or not they wish to watch it with you.
decline_text: No... what if they think you're weird for wanting to watch your dead ancestors fall out the sky?!

success_outcomes.text: You find them while they're getting some fresh kill and ask if they'd like to attend with you. They seem to be happy that you asked! You had a wonderful evening watching the stars with them.

fail_outcomes.text: They were talking to another cat, when you found them. They gently informed you that they were watching it with someone else. You slink off, embarrassed. You felt so bad that you didn't even go to see it.

intro_text: A storm rolls into the side of the coast. It's an odd thought, but after you got stuck in a storm once, you were in awe of the streaks of lightning. Perhaps r_c would enjoy spending some time with you?
decline_text: That's a horrible idea. You shake it out of your head, and move on.

success_outcomes.text: You're almost surprised when r_c's eyes light up with interest. You both spend time in the shelter of a Twoleg path, watching lightning arc out of the sky beautifully. r_c gets a bit spooked, and inches closer to you for shelter. You try to hide behind your whiskers.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c declines your offer, having some clear disgust of the idea. Hopefully it was the thunderstorm part, and not spending time with you.

intro_text: You and r_c are out on a walk alone at the rise of dawn. You take a moment to sit down on a small hill and look at the rising sun. You wonder if this moment can become something more intimate between you and r_c.
decline_text: You're too nervous to inch closer, deciding it must be too soon. What if r_c thinks you're acting out of place?

success_outcomes.text: You gently lean into r_c, resting your head on their shoulder. You can hear a purr emanating from their throat, and they slowly lay their chin on the top of your head as you watch the sunrise together.

fail_outcomes.text: You slowly inch closer to r_c and lean your head on their shoulder, but they glare you down and scoot away uncomfortably. Ouch, that was awkward...

intro_text: Harsh winds are roaming the air today, and the sea is looking wild. You remember when you as an apprentice jumped out to play in the waves - perhaps r_c would want to play with you today?
decline_text: Maybe some other day. Right now, the sea looks a little too wild.

success_outcomes.text: They agree! Phew. The two of you have a wonderful day, jumping around in the waves and engaging in small water fights, and you feel like your connection has strengthened.

fail_outcomes.text: They agree, and you walk out to the seabank together. When you've stepped out in the water, r_c looks at you questionably, not seeming to understand why you think this is fun. You attempt to show them as you joyfully jump around, but a sharp wave hits r_c and they hiss loudly, walking back with a soaked pelt. Maybe this wasn't the best idea after all..

intro_text: As you wander out by the cliffs with r_c you notice a few pretty flowers sticking out of a pile of snow. Perhaps you should pick some for them?
decline_text: You don't want to risk getting your paws all cold and wet - and worse, what if r_c doesn't want them?

success_outcomes.text: You tell r_c to stop for a moment as you carefully lift the flowers. r_c looks confused, but lights up in a smile as you drop the flowers in front of them. They decide to wear the flowers on their pelt, and you feel all warm and fuzzy as you continue the patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: You tell r_c to stop for a quick moment, but as you struggle to pick the flowers, r_c states that you don't have time for this. You decide to leave the pretty flowers, but you can't help but keep looking back at them with disappointment as you continue the patrol.

intro_text: You ponder whether you should ask r_c on an evening patrol with just the two of you. The warm breeze blowing may stir up some hidden feelings.
decline_text: You decide not to. The thought of rejection is too overwhelming.

success_outcomes.text: r_c happily agrees saying they'd love to go out with you. The two of you wander through c_n's territory and you find yourself staring at them for extended periods of time. How have you never noticed their beauty?

fail_outcomes.text: r_c frowns, asking you why there won't be more cats on the patrol. You feel your ears burn and mumble an apology before hurrying off to your nest. The rest of the evening and the morning of the next day leaves an awkward tension between you and r_c.

intro_text: You leave camp on a moon high patrol with r_c. It's getting close to leafbare, and the air is starting to get frigid. You think about pressing up against r_c and wrapping your tail around them. Just because it's cold!
decline_text: Nope. You don't do that. That would be weird. You choose to respect r_c's boundaries.

success_outcomes.text: You lean against them and they let out a surprised purr, and thank you. They joked that they were getting cold, but now they're at the perfect temperature thanks to you.

fail_outcomes.text: They hiss a warning at you, asking what you're doing and you retreat immediately. The rest of the patrol is painfully awkward.

intro_text: As you pad around the land, you spot r_c sitting at your favorite pond. They are looking longingly into the sky. You debate approaching them.
decline_text: Nevermind, you have an important patrol ahead. You decide to move onwards.

success_outcomes.text: With a large sigh, you follow the path leading over to them. You both smile at each other and eventually you both entwine your tails together.

fail_outcomes.text: You trot up to r_c and sit down. They nervously shuffles away and politely declines. You walk away to continue your patrol, embarrassed.

intro_text: It's a foggy morning, but a sound on the breeze catches your attention. Immediately, r_c pops into your brain. They would want to see this.
decline_text: It's too early in the morning, r_c enjoys their rest.

success_outcomes.text: r_c seems surprised to see you when they open their eyes, but eventually get to their feet. As the morning sun turns orange with the dawn, the two of you watch in silence. The local hawk's nest has hatched, and every now and again, you catch a glimpse of a chick.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c doesn't even stir from their nest, rather swats you away.

intro_text: You're out fishing with r_c when you notice them staring into the dark water with a sad expression on their muzzle.
decline_text: You decide it's not your place to be nosy. You respect r_c's boundaries, after all. If it was important, they'd tell you, right?

success_outcomes.text: You carefully ask r_c what's on their head. They tell you about how they've been feeling worthless lately, and the dark, cloudy weather hasn't been helping. They splash the water in frustration. You give them a soft smile and reassure them of their worth, splashing some water back at them. The moment of sadness turns into a fun water fight.

fail_outcomes.text: You ask r_c what's on their head, but they shrug you off and dismiss their worries, instead telling you to focus on the task at paw. You both go back to fishing in an awkward atmosphere. Does r_c not trust you enough? Are you annoying them...?

intro_text: You need herbs for the medicine den, and decide to bring r_c with you. You appreciate them coming with you, the extra paws are a massive help! You notice how their fur sparkles beautifully with dew, looking almost like silverpelt had come alive on them. You consider telling them so.
decline_text: Nope. They're here on business. They're just helping you get herbs. Don't get any weird ideas.

success_outcomes.text: r_c purred in amusement, telling you that you look very pretty yourself. You go the rest of your day holding your tail high in pride.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c sighs and tells you to focus on finding herbs so they can get back to camp. You're genuinely upset by this. Do they not like spending time with you? It was only a joke, you keep telling both them and yourself to save yourself the deadly claws to your pride.

intro_text: You decide to take r_c to a lovely view in the early hours of dawn. The cliffs provide a stunning vision of the sun rising. After a while of staring, your tail brushes against r_c's and you wonder if now would be the time to ask them if they feel anything for you...
decline_text: No! No way in StarClan! You're too awkward for that! So you just sit in silence with them.

success_outcomes.text: You nervously ask r_c and they look away, blushing a bit. They purr and tell you to just focus on the sky though you can't help but notice them glancing at you affectionately every now and then.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c stares at you with an awkward expression. You got the wrong idea. They just wanted to enjoy the sunrise. But now, they can't. r_c walks away in a huff, leaving you upset...

intro_text: You decide to take r_c on a walk around the borders on a warm night and spot a twoleg kit playing in the dirt. r_c gives you a look and a curious purr.
decline_text: You shake your head and r_c seems almost disappointed, but keeps up.

success_outcomes.text: You can't help but see what they are thinking and agree, watching as r_c creeps through some tall grass before leaping out and scaring the twoleg kit. On the way back, you and r_c joke about what happened and have a great new joke.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c creeps through the grass and instead gets spotted by a second twoleg kit. r_c gets scooped up and you quickly jump in and scare the twoleg kits off. r_c sits beside you, panicked, as you try to comfort them. Instead they just get distant and ask to finish the patrol.

intro_text: You and r_c encounter a huge, open field in the territory. Whilst there's many out in the plains, none had quite as many flowers as this one. Your gaze catches on r_c's before you begin to run, hoping they'll follow.
decline_text: You slow to a stop, feeling stupid for even trying to do that. You stutter out an excuse to r_c before heading back over to them, your ears burning with embarrassment.

success_outcomes.text: r_c runs alongside you with a happy yowl, the two of you running through the flowers and sending petals and grasshoppers flying everywhere. Eventually, you stop near the edge of the field, laughing happily and admiring the excited twinkle in r_c's eyes.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c just stands there as you begin to run and you slow to a stop, mewing confusedly at them. They glare at you, telling you to get back to work as they turn to continue on the intended patrol path... you can't help but shrink from how awkward that was.

intro_text: You and r_c take a walk through the forest at night, the soft croaking of frogs seeming to ring out to the beat of your pawsteps. You spot a long field of grass, and remember something someone taught you when you were just a kit. You turn to r_c, wanting to ask them something.
decline_text: You can't muster up the courage to ask, and turn back to the patrol, your gaze flitting back to the field longingly.

success_outcomes.text: You ask if they'd like to run through the field. Confused, they agree, and gasp once they do. Fireflies flew out of the long grass, swirling around the two of you like a spiral of lights. However, the only light that catches your eye is the joy in theirs.

fail_outcomes.text: You ask if they'd like to run through the field. Confused, they refuse, and tell you to get back to patrolling.

intro_text: You and r_c pad along the coast, the glittering waves of the cool water lapping at your paws. r_c was looking especially tense lately, and you wished to see their warm smile appear on their face once again. Looking at the rising and falling waves, you notice coquina clams being pulled out of the sand and quickly burying themselves back under, and you get an idea.
decline_text: But due to the anxiety in your heart that you would accidentally make r_c more tense then they already are, you say nothing and the two of you continue the patrol in silence.

success_outcomes.text: Quickly grabbing r_c's attention with a playful mew, you dash towards the small oncoming wave and gracefully leap into it. r_c yelped in shock and waded slowly into the water to find you and make sure you were okay, until your soaked head popped out of the water with a colorful coquina clam in your jaws. r_c was confused for a moment until you started imitating a silly voice, doing your best to open and close the clam in sync with your words. They burst out in laughter, their warm smile back on their beautifully lit face from the dusk.

fail_outcomes.text: You dash into the water and jump into an oncoming wave, but you underestimated how strong the wave was going to be, and you were immediately pushed back onto the shore on your back. You hoped that your failed attempt at swimming would make r_c giggle even a little bit, but watching you suddenly leap into the water and be aggressively thrown by a wave only heightened r_c's stress levels, and they now walked ahead of you after heavily reprimanding you on the dangers of the ocean. That clearly didn't make them feel better...

intro_text: You and r_c take a walk along the edge of the territory, trees gently swaying and birds calling in the breeze overhead. You notice a scrap of leaf clinging to r_c's fur and consider brushing it off with your tail... but, no. Would that be too weird?
decline_text: You decide to play it safe and simply tell r_c about the leaf scrap instead. The rest of the walk goes smoothly enough, but you can't stop wondering what could have been.

success_outcomes.text: You gently brush your tail across r_c's shoulder blade, and they thank you with a purr that's a little too warm for the simplicity of the favor.

fail_outcomes.text: You move to brush off the leaf, but r_c flinches away and demands to know what you're doing. The rest of the walk is taken in awkward silence.

intro_text: You were on a hunting patrol with r_c, and after catching mouthfuls of prey, you and r_c decided to take a break. You've noticed how pretty the maple leaves look, and wanted to give some to them. Was it a good choice, though?
decline_text: You decided not to, and finish the break after a short while to resume hunting.

success_outcomes.text: You stood up and collected the prettiest of maple leaves, and after gathering a good load of them, you stepped over and showed r_c the leaves. They look joyous and gracefully receive the maple leaves from your paw, putting them on their ear.

fail_outcomes.text: They saw you looking around for the leaves and asked what you were doing. You are unsure of what to reply, so you just say you were wandering around. They didn't ask you anything anymore, and you gave up, soon resuming the patrol.

intro_text: You were told about the blue supermoon, and decided it will be a good opportunity to ask r_c out. You padded up to them, but hesitated. What if it doesn't go as planned?
decline_text: You couldn't gather enough courage for this, so you stopped and turned away. Guess tonight you'll be enjoying it by yourself.

success_outcomes.text: They turned back, looking at you- and you successfully asked them without stuttering if they wanted to go see the blue supermoon tonight with you. They happily agreed, and when the time comes, you and them sit on top of a tall tree, gazing at the bright, massive, slightly blue-colored moon and the countless sparkly stars together. You felt extremely happy to hear r_c's soft purrs and see their face being lit up.

fail_outcomes.text: They politely decline, saying that they had to go on a night patrol, and you weren't selected with them. Seems like tonight you two will be watching the moon from different parts of the territory... or it's only r_c that's watching.

intro_text: You and r_c go out in the Dark Forest, away from the spirits and trainees. r_c - who you've been practicing with and secretly admiring - enthusiastically offers to teach you some of their forbidden moves. Should you practice with them?
decline_text: You feel as if this were a bit too risky. You nervously decline r_c's offer.

success_outcomes.text: You and r_c practice these forbidden moves together. You feel more confident and strong. Later, you and r_c later take a break in the muck, heavily breathing, lightly scratched, but your love and cooperation with r_c slowly growing.

fail_outcomes.text: You and r_c practice these forbidden moves together, but after a while, you think to yourself how dangerous this is, and ask r_c to take a break. As you lay in the muck, your eyes slowly close, and you wake up, bleeding from the wounds from training.

intro_text: One of your trainees, r_c, who is also your clanmate, is being taunted and mistreated by a Dark Forest spirit. You feel like stepping up, but you might be injured.
decline_text: You don't feel like risking it, so you let r_c be.

success_outcomes.text: You decide to step up, and you approach the spirit who had been berating r_c. They angrily hiss at you and leap on you, and you give them a good fight before making them flee off. r_c thanks you, and they help lick your minor wounds clean, but you soon notice yourself leaning on them, tails twining.

fail_outcomes.text: As you step up, the spirit angrily hisses at you, but you give them a good fight before they flee. You are minorly injured, but r_c doesn't seem to notice this, and they stroll off through the muck without a care about checking on you or thanking you!

intro_text: A Dark Forest cat whispers threats into your ear and taunts you. A fellow clanmate sees you and decides to help, chasing the spirit away. You feel your heart beating full of love, wanting to say something.
decline_text: You walk away, hastily, dragging your tail through the muck. Maybe you weren't meant for them.

success_outcomes.text: You respond to the cat a simple thanks, and the cat introduces themself as r_c, which you immediately recognized was from your clan. They then talk to you for a bit, but you feel as if you are being watched behind your back by the residents of the Dark Forest.

fail_outcomes.text: You awkwardly stutter a thanks to the cat, which they hesitantly introduce themselves as r_c, but after that, they quickly walk through the muck, away from your sight. Your ears feel hot from embarrassment.

intro_text: You and r_c end up on a patrol together. As you walk together through your clan's territory, the smell of budding plants fills your nostrils and your attention is drawn to r_c. Did they always look so nice? You can't seem to look away, their luxurious fur, the way they walk..
decline_text: You shake off the feeling. There are more important things to do than to swoon at a stupid crush.

success_outcomes.text: As you stare over at them, they slowly swivel their head to see you gawking, and chuckle lightly before giving you a warm look. Your heart flutters!

fail_outcomes.text: As you stare over at them, their fur prickles and they turn around to see you gawking. They give you a confused and disgusted glare.

intro_text: You are assigned one of the more tedious chores around camp. As you're preparing to start, an idea pops into your mind; You could ask r_c if they would want to help out! It would make the chore easier, and you'd get to spend time together!
decline_text: You decide not to bother r_c, and instead dive into the chore on your own.

success_outcomes.text: You are thrilled when r_c happily agrees to help. Though the chore is boring, the two of you joke around and have fun, and before you know it, you're all done. The two of you continue messing around afterwards, and you feel a happy flutter in your chest.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c gives an apologetic look; wouldn't it be better for one cat to do it? Then they wouldn't be in the way... You mutter in agreement, and hurry away. How embarrassing!

intro_text: You've wanted to get closer to r_c for a while now, but you're not quite sure how to do it. An idea strikes you as you consider asking r_c if they'd want to accompany you on a morning stroll out of camp.
decline_text: You try to muster up the courage to approach them, but you can't quite seem to catch them at the right time. Your struggle goes on for so long that it's no longer early morning, and you quietly resign yourself to a lonely stroll by yourself for the following days.

success_outcomes.text: r_c agrees to walk with you out of camp, and you have to keep yourself from jumping in joy. In the soft morning light of early sunrise, you quietly admire their side profile to yourself, awed by how their fur looks under the golden lighting.

fail_outcomes.text: You gather your courage and ask, but you know you've failed as soon as r_c averts their eyes and shuffles their paws awkwardly. They try to let you down gently, but the rejection stings sharply in your chest as you watch them walk away.

intro_text: You and r_c are assigned in a patrol together, knowing that this is your chance to express your feelings towards them.
decline_text: You decide to focus on your task instead.

success_outcomes.text: As r_c and you gather moss, you sheepishly express your love towards them, and they quickly turn their head towards you, and giggles a little, telling you how they have always known how you felt about them, but your shocked expression is full of joy and love. r_c and you manage to gather moss while talking and making jokes together, and when you return to camp, a new aura emerges from r_c.

fail_outcomes.text: You stutter a lot while trying to express your love towards r_c, but they awkwardly turn their head to look at you, cringing. With their mouth full of moss, r_c doesn't talk to you after that patrol, and quickly continues their duties without interacting with you afterwards.
